complexity.business: 5: Critical go-to-market decision affecting product positioning, launch timeline, and user acquisition
complexity.coordination: 1: Solo decision by Moti with Claude as sounding board

summary: Multi-provider launch would delay 1-2+ months → Launch with Claude + Memory FIRST, add other providers 2-4 weeks after public release
root_cause: Waiting for multi-provider implementation (Codex, Gemini, Qwen) would significantly delay time-to-market without proportional value gain at launch

solution.approach: Phased launch strategy - prove concept with best experience first, expand provider support based on user feedback
key_changes: PHASE 2: Additional providers 2-4 weeks later (Codex, Gemini, Qwen - order TBD)

validation: Strategy validated through discussion - focuses effort on polish over breadth, enables faster user feedback loop
lesson: Better to launch with ONE excellent experience than wait months for FOUR mediocre experiences. Real user feedback beats hypothetical multi-provider planning.

phase_1_initial_release.killer_feature: Persistent Memory System (semantic search, notebook, delta memories)
phase_1_initial_release.pricing_model: Not addressing at launch - focus on product quality
phase_1_initial_release.pre_launch_validation: Show to trusted circle who understand the vision → gather feedback → iterate
phase_1_initial_release.marketing_message: Sementix: Claude Code with Persistent Memory
phase_1_initial_release.timeline: When it feels ready and polished (weeks to ~1 month)

phase_2_provider_expansion.order: TBD based on user feedback and demand
phase_2_provider_expansion.rationale: Real user feedback will inform which providers to prioritize

blockers: Chat UI needs polish and bug fixes

permission_system.requirement: Permission dialogs must work smoothly without bugs

error_handling.requirement: Graceful error messages and recovery flows

documentation.note: Moti says this is fine - will create for launch
documentation.scope: Single provider makes docs simpler and more focused

strategic_advantages.focus: One provider = can make EVERYTHING perfect instead of spreading effort thin
strategic_advantages.feedback_loop: Real users using real product beats hypothetical planning
strategic_advantages.narrative_clarity: Claude Code with Memory is a clear, simple value proposition
strategic_advantages.quality_baseline: Sets high bar that future providers must match
strategic_advantages.marketing_momentum: Phase 2 provider launches become re-launch moments
strategic_advantages.risk_reduction: Simpler initial release = fewer things that can go wrong
strategic_advantages.memory_showcase: Memory system becomes THE differentiator, not just a feature among many providers

decision_rationale.moti_quote: If we wait for other providers it can take at least month or even in worse case 2+. Yes the decision has been made.
decision_rationale.core_insight: Why wait 1-2+ months when you can launch NOW with a great experience?
decision_rationale.validation_approach: Polish product → show trusted circle → gather feedback → launch publicly
decision_rationale.open_source_decision: Closed source on GitHub for now - 'it's hard for me to make it open source at the moment'
decision_rationale.no_pricing_complexity: 'Pricing is not something we deal with right now' - focus purely on product

immediate_priorities: Complete UI polish and bug fixes (currently working on chat animations)
Polish error handling and recovery flows
Create focused documentation for Claude + Memory workflow
pre_launch_checklist: Full product walkthrough with trusted advisors
Gather feedback from people who understand the vision
Final polish based on trusted circle feedback
post_launch_phase_1: Iterate based on actual usage patterns

user_context.development_style: quality-focused - will launch when it feels polished, not on arbitrary deadline
user_context.naming_preferences: clear-and-direct - 'Claude Code with Memory' tells the story
user_context.architecture_philosophy: phased-rollout - prove value incrementally rather than big-bang launch

moti_wisdom.on_timing: If we wait for other providers it can take at least month or even in worse case 2+
moti_wisdom.on_validation: I polish our product, I will show it when its fully working to some people I know that understand. And launch it.
moti_wisdom.on_scope: VS Code marketplace. GitHub as well but as closed source for now - (its hard for me to make it open source at the moment)
moti_wisdom.on_simplicity: Pricing is not something we deal with right now
moti_wisdom.on_decisiveness: Yes the decision has been made.
